name: Spanish Chickpea Stew with Cauliflower Broccoli Rice
description: Flavorful Spanish Chickpea Stew with Cumin scented Cauliflower Broccoli Rice. Smoky tomatoey 30 Minute Spanish Chickpea Stew can be served over rice or grains or cauliflower or broccoli rice. Vegan Gluten-free Nut-free Grain-free Soy-free Recipe.

video.name: SPANISH CHICKPEA STEW WITH CAULIFLOWER RICE | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Flavorful Spanish Chickpea Stew with Cumin scented Cauliflower Broccoli Rice. 30 Mins!
❤️ FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2017/04/spanish-chickpea-stew-with-cauliflower-broccoli-rice.html

This Spanish Stew is smoky, tomatoey, 1 Pot and amazing and comes together really quickly. If you already have some rice to serve it over, then this is a One Pot meal and ready within 30 minutes!

I serve the stew over rice, or Cauliflower rice, or Broccoli + cauliflower rice. Cauliflower and Broccoli are riced in a processor. They are flavored with toasted cumin, salt and lemon and steamed to make a fluffy al dente cooked mixture. The Stew uses onion and tomato base with bay leaves, paprika and oregano for flavor. Change up the beans, add some veggies or greens for variation. 
Vegan Gluten-free Nut-free Grain-free Soy-free Recipe.


❤️ BUY MY COOKBOOK Vegan Richa's Everyday Kitchen - 140 Recipes, 100+ Easy Meals, Awesome Sauces, & some Breakfast and Dessert. https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-richas-everyday-kitchen

recipeIngredient: 12  oz of canned diced tomatoes (unsalted, or 2 large juicy tomatoes)
3/4 tsp paprika (smoky or a combination of sweet and smoky)
a generous dash of black pepper
1 15 oz can chickpeas (drained or 1.5 cups cooked chickpeas)
1.5 cups vegetables chopped small  (such as cauliflower, carrots, zucchini, green or red bell pepper)
1/2 to 3/4 tsp salt (depends on if the chickpeas are already salted)
1/2 tsp sugar  (or maple syrup or other sweetener)
1.5 cups cauliflower florets or 1 cup grated or shredded (heaped)
1.5 cups broccoli florets or 1 scant cup shredded
a good dash of lemon juice

itemListElement.text: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until translucent, stirring occasionally. 3 mins.
itemListElement.name: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until translucent, stirring occasionally. 3 mins.

itemListElement.text: Meanwhile, blend the tomato with the ginger to puree and keep ready. Alternatively use tomato puree and minced ginger.
itemListElement.name: Meanwhile, blend the tomato with the ginger to puree and keep ready. Alternatively use tomato puree and minced ginger.

itemListElement.text: Add the spices to the saucepan and mix for a few seconds. Add tomato ginger puree to the saucepan and cook for 4 minutes until starting to thicken, stir occasionally. (add a tbsp tomato paste for color and flavor if using fresh tomatoes).
itemListElement.name: Add the spices to the saucepan and mix for a few seconds. Add tomato ginger puree to the saucepan and cook for 4 minutes until starting to thicken, stir occasionally. (add a tbsp tomato paste for color and flavor if using fresh tomatoes).

itemListElement.text: Add the chickpeas and the vegetables and mix in. Add water and salt, sugar/sweetener and cook partially covered for 10 to 12 minutes until vegetables are tender. Fold in baby spinach or greens at this point if using. Taste and adjust salt and heat. Add a dash of lemon to balance if needed.
itemListElement.name: Add the chickpeas and the vegetables and mix in. Add water and salt, sugar/sweetener and cook partially covered for 10 to 12 minutes until vegetables are tender. Fold in baby spinach or greens at this point if using. Taste and adjust salt and heat. Add a dash of lemon to balance if needed.

itemListElement.text: Grate or shred the cauliflower and broccoli in a food processor. Pulse until it is evenly shredded. Heat oil over medium in a skillet. Add cumin seeds and let them start to change color. 1 minute. Add grated cauliflower and broccoli mix well. Add salt, garlic and cayenne and mix well. Reduce heat to medium low. Cover and cook for 4 to 5 minutes. Add a dash of lemon fluff and cover and let it continue to steam in its own heat for another 2 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Grate or shred the cauliflower and broccoli in a food processor. Pulse until it is evenly shredded. Heat oil over medium in a skillet. Add cumin seeds and let them start to change color. 1 minute. Add grated cauliflower and broccoli mix well. Add salt, garlic and cayenne and mix well. Reduce heat to medium low. Cover and cook for 4 to 5 minutes. Add a dash of lemon fluff and cover and let it continue to steam in its own heat for another 2 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Add individual serving to bowls with the chickpea stew, some cilantro, chopped red onion, crunchy veggies or greens. Serve hot.
itemListElement.name: Add individual serving to bowls with the chickpea stew, some cilantro, chopped red onion, crunchy veggies or greens. Serve hot.
